name: antegrade
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
used to describe a forward direction or movement, for example the normal flow of blood in the body: The treatment resulted in improved antegrade pulmonary blood flow. Antegrade and retrograde catheters are placed prior to cross-clamping. See also
anterograde
More examplesFewer examplesThere was impaired antegrade aortic blood flow and consequent reduced cerebral blood flow.Recent advances have led to improved technical success rates for antegrade ureteric stent placement.In the figures shown, the flow above the red line is antegrade whereas the blood flow under the red line is retrograde.
